note.p: Death: South Crescent, Bedford Square, London (02 June 1849)
Education: Studied law under his uncle, John Wilson, town clerk of Glasgow; LLD (1844, Glasgow)

Career: Practised as a solicitor; inherited his uncle's fortune on Wilson's death (1806) and added the name Wilson to his own by letters patent; travelled in Egypt, Palestine and Europe and wrote about his travels; gave University of Glasgow Â£300 to fund annual prize for an essay on Christ; buried under an oriental-style monument
